intro: Leptobotrys, commonly known as the slender-leaved tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, often opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. The genus includes several species, many of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and Africa. Leptobotrys species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruits are usually small berries that may contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy pulp.
